variant.question: A Power Transfer Unit (PTU) is powered by...

options.text: a hydraulic motor.
a mechanical gearbox.
aircraft engine.
an electric motor.

variant.question: The by-pass air in a turbo fan engine has the effect of a lower specific fuel consumption by causing an overall

options.text: decrease in average exhaust gas flow velocity and a higher mass flow.
increase in the mean jet temperature and increase in thermal efficiency.
increase in average exhaust gas flow velocity thus increasing engine pressure ratio.
decrease in combustion chamber temperature and higher thermal efficiency.

variant.question: Special fuel consumption schedules during flight are designed

options.text: to minimise the wing G-loads and preserve main tank fuel for landing.
to ensure fastest rate of fuel dumping in case of emergency where time is critical.
to keep wing fuel as low as possible in event of a crash-landing.
to keep fuel from freezing during high level cruise for a longer period of time.

variant.question: Specific fuel consumption is defined as the

options.text: mass of fuel required to produce unit power for unit time.
maximum fuel consumption of the aircraft.
designed fuel consumption for a given RPM.
quantity of fuel required to run the engine for one minute at maximum operating conditions.

variant.question: The thermal efficiency of a piston engine is about:
The power output of a piston engine can be calculated by

options.text: torque × RPM.
work × velocity.
pressure × arm.
force × distance.

variant.question: A twin-spool gas turbine engine is one in which the:

options.text: LP turbine drives the LP compressor and the HP turbine drives the HP compressor.
turbines are free to rotate at speeds that differ from their associated compressors.
LP turbine drives both the LP compressor and the HP compressor.
LP compressor drives the HP compressor.

variant.question: The primary performance indicator (cockpit instrument) for the thrust of a turbofan engine is:

options.text: either EPR or N1.
either N1 or fuel flow.
either N1 or N2.
either torque or RPM.

variant.question:
The bypass ratio:
1) is the ratio of bypass air mass flow to HP compressor mass flow.
2) can be determined from the inlet air volume flow and the HP compressor volume flow.

options.text: 1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.

variant.question:
The bypass ratio:
1) is the ratio of inlet air mass flow to HP compressor mass flow.
2) can be determined from the inlet air volume flow and the HP compressor volume flow.

options.text: 1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.

variant.question: A gas turbine blade is most frequently of the

options.text: impulse / reaction type.
Pelton wheel type.
impulse type.
reaction type.

variant.question:
The bypass ratio:
  1. is the ratio of inlet airflow to HP compressor flow.
  2. can be determined from the inlet air mass flow and the HP compressor mass flow.

options.text: 1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
1 is incorrect, 2 is incorrect.
1 is correct, 2 is correct.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.

variant.question: The fan of a turbo-fan engine is driven by:

options.text: the LP turbine.
the HP turbine.
airflow drawn across it by the HP compressor.
the HP compressor through reduction gearing.

variant.question: After air has passed through the compressor of a gas turbine engine the:

options.text: temperature will be higher than the inlet temperature.
pressure will be the same as the inlet pressure.
velocity will be higher than the inlet velocity.
velocity will be the same as the inlet velocity.

variant.question: In a gas turbine combustion chamber:

options.text: secondary air is required for cooling of the inner casing.
the axial velocity of the gas stream is greatest behind the swirl vanes.
the gas pressure increases in an axial (downstream) direction.
the gas temperature is highest at the chamber outlet.

variant.question: A turbofan engine with an inlet air mass flow of 1 000 kg/s and a HP compressor mass flow of 111 kg/s has a bypass ratio of
Creep in a gas turbine engine is

options.text: the permanent increase in length of metal parts due to a combination of tensile stress and high temperatures over a prolonged period.
the elastic increase in length of metal parts due to tensile stress and high temperatures.
expansion of metal parts due to temperature increase.
crack formation in metal parts due to cyclic mechanical loads and high temperatures.

variant.question: If a twin-spool gas turbine engine is controlled by a conventional N2 control system, rupture of the LP shaft may result in

options.text: overspeed of the LP turbine.
N1 and N2 increase.
N2 and EPR increase.
N1 decrease and EPR increase.

variant.question: A basic gas-turbine engine consists of

options.text: an air intake, compressor, combustion chamber, turbine, and exhaust nozzle.
a fan, combustion chamber, turbine, and outlet.
an air intake, compressor, combustion chamber, turbine, and gearbox.
an inlet, fan, combustion chamber, free turbine, and exhaust-gas outlet.

variant.question: The propulsive efficiency of a turbo jet is the ratio of

options.text: propelling nozzle thrust to energy supplied to the nozzle.
nozzle gas flow to intake gas flow.
jet pipe pressure to air intake pressure.
lbs fuel burned to lbs thrust developed.

variant.question: Some gas turbine engines have multiple stages in the HP and LP turbines:

options.text: is equipped with two exciter units and two igniter plugs.
is cross-connected directly between the engines.
has exciter units equipped with internal batteries.
operates on a continuous basis following an engine start.

variant.question: Bypass ratio is

options.text:
The ratio of the mass flow rate of air from the fan disc that
bypasses the engine core to the mass flow rate passing through the engine core
The ratio of N2 to N1
The rate of Fuel to Air
The ratio of air that is turned in to waste gases

variant.question: A 'free turbine' in a gas turbine engine is a turbine

options.text: that does not drive a compressor.
in a twin-spool aircraft gas turbine driving a fan.
that can be decoupled with a free-wheel clutch.
that drives the high pressure compressor of a twin-spool engine.

variant.question:
The characteristics of a centrifugal compressor in a gas turbine engine are:

1 – a high pressure ratio by stage.2 – a large engine diameter compared to the inlet diameter.3 – a low pressure ratio by stage.4 – a small engine diameter compared to the inlet diameter..
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:
The FADEC of a gas turbine engine normally includes:

options.text: an engine overspeed and/or an EGT protection function.
an excessive fuel flow detection function.
the engine fire loops.
an overheat protection for the electronic engine control unit.

variant.question: The thermal efficiency of a gas turbine engine will increase with a

options.text: decrease in ambient air temperature.
decrease in ambient air pressure.
increase in humidity.
increase in ambient air temperature.

variant.question:
Refer to figure. 
 The type of gas turbine illustrated comprises a:

options.text: free turbine and a centrifugal compressor.
single shaft turbine and a centrifugal compressor.
free turbine and an axial compressor.
single shaft turbine and an axial compressor.

variant.question: A vent valve in the combustion chamber of a gas turbine engine...

options.text: allows leftover fuel to drain out of the bottom of the combustion chamber.
allows for a pilot to take a fuel sample directly from the engine.
prevents a wet start.
allows the fuel tanks to be emptied for maintenance.

variant.question: The greatest risk created by a free turbine overspeed is:

options.text: bursting of the free turbine disk.
a surge of the gas generator.
an engine overtemperature.
creep of the turbine blades.

variant.question: A free power turbine is where the power output shaft (1) _____ connected to the compressor, enabling (2) _____ to operate at its optimal speed.

options.text: (1) is not; (2) the compressor
(1) is; (2) the compressor
(1) is not; (2) the turbine
(1) is; (2) the turbine

variant.question: In an engine having a free turbine:

options.text: there is a mechanical connection between the power output shaft and the free turbine.
there is a mechanical connection between the compressor and the propeller shaft.
there is no mechanical connection between the power output shaft and the free turbine.
air enters via compressor inlet on the turbine.

variant.question: A twin-spool engine with a bypass mass flow of 250 kg/s and a HP compressor mass flow of 250 kg/s has a bypass ratio of:
When a gas turbine engine is fitted with can-type combustion chambers

options.text: a total of only two igniters are usually fitted since the chambers are inter-connected.
each chamber has its own igniter.
each chamber is fitted with two igniters.
each chamber is fitted with one igniter and one glow plug.

variant.question: An axial compressor in a gas turbine engine, when operating below its design speed, has:

options.text: a tendency to stall in the front stages.
no tendency to stall.
a tendency to stall in the centre stages.
a tendency to stall in the rear stages.

variant.question: In the exhaust section of a gas turbine engine, the

options.text: convergent duct accelerates the air in a rearward direction.
compressor accelerates the air in a rearward direction.
turbine extracts energy to drive the main transmission gearbox.
turbine extracts energy to drive the compressor.

variant.question: The fuel-oil heat exchanger of a gas turbine engine:

options.text: cools the oil and heats the fuel.
cools both the oil and the fuel.
cools the oil only.
heats the fuel only.

variant.question: The FADEC of a gas turbine engine consists of:

options.text: an electronic engine control unit and its peripherals (fuel metering, actuators, electrical wiring, sensors).
all electronic engine control units installed on the aircraft.
an electronic engine control unit only.
an electronic engine control unit and the engine display units in the cockpit.

variant.question: The FADEC of a gas turbine engine consists of:

options.text: an electronic engine control unit and its peripherals (fuel metering, actuators, electrical wiring, sensors...).
all electronic engine control units installed on the aircraft.
an electronic engine control unit and the engine display units in the cockpit.
an electronic engine control unit only.

variant.question: A booster or LP compressor in a twin spool turbofan:

options.text: rotates at the same rotor speed as the fan.
rotates at the same rotor speed as the HP turbine.
rotates at a rotor speed different from both fan, HP compressor and HP turbine.
rotates at the same rotor speed as the HP compressor.

variant.question: In the stator of a turbine, the gas velocity V and static pressure p vary as follows:

options.text: V increases, p decreases.
V decreases, p decreases.
V increases, p increases.
V decreases, p increases.

variant.question: Increasing the power setting of a gas turbine engine with a constant speed propeller and free power turbine causes...

options.text: both HP spool speed and EGT to increase.
HP spool speed to increase and EGT to remain constant.
HP spool speed to remain constant and EGT to increase.
HP spool speed to decrease and EGT to increase.

variant.question: In a single spool gas turbine engine, the compressor rpm is:

options.text: The same as the turbine rpm.
Independent of the turbine rpm.
Less than the turbine rpm.
Greater than the turbine rpm.

variant.question: In a multi-spool turbofan engine, the fan is driven by:

options.text: the rearmost turbine.
all three turbines since they are on a common shaft with the compressor.
the intermediate turbine.
the foremost turbine.

variant.question: In a gas turbine engine using pure reaction type turbine blades, rotational forces are the direct result of...

options.text: aerodynamic action caused by convergent areas between turbine blades.
increased gas velocity caused by divergent areas between turbine blades.
decreased gas velocity caused by convergent areas between turbine stators.
aerodynamic action caused by divergent areas between turbine blades.

variant.question: Concerning a gas turbine engine, one of the advantages of annular combustion chamber over a multiple can is that:

options.text: the thermal load distribution on the HP turbine is more favourable.
only one igniter is required.
assembly and disassembly is easier.
engine length is shorter because no diffuser is required.

variant.question: Jet engine total efficiency indicates the efficiency at which:

options.text: chemical power in the fuel is transformed into propulsive power (T x V).
the increase of jet kinetic energy is transformed into propulsive energy.
chemical power in the fuel is transformed into an increase of jet kinetic energy per second.
potential energy in the jet is transformed into propulsive energy.

variant.question: One of the advantages of multiple-spool jet engine designs is that:

options.text: a smaller air starter driving only a single spool can be used.
engine length can be reduced.
a compressor stall cannot occur under any condition.
if one spool seizes, the remaining spool (s) will continue to operate normally.

variant.question: One of the advantages of multiple-spool jet engine designs is that:

options.text: a smaller air starter driving only a single spool can be used.
a compressor stall cannot occur under any condition.
if one spool seizes, the remaining spool(s) will continue to operate normally.
engine length can be reduced.

variant.question: One advantage of having three instead of two spools in some high-bypass turbofan engine is that:

options.text: fewer variable stator vanes and variable inlet guide vanes are required to prevent compressor stall at low rotor speeds.
there is a lower fuel consumption due to a higher overall pressure ratio.
there is a lower fuel consumption and more thrust due to higher overall pressure ratio.
fewer variable stator vanes and variable inlet guide vanes are required to prevent compressor stall at high rotor speeds.

variant.question: The fan in a high by-pass ratio turbo-jet engine produces:

options.text: the greatest part of the thrust.
the least part of the thrust.
half the thrust.
none of the thrust.

variant.question: Specific fuel consumption for a turbo-prop engine can be expressed in kg per:

options.text: hour per unit of shaft power.
unit of shaft power.
hour per km.
hour per nm.

variant.question: The main stress factor(s) for the material used in the turbine section of a gas turbine engine is/are:

options.text: High temperatures and rapid temperature changes.
High acceleration forces at the turbine inlet guide vanes.
Chemical abrasion caused by combustion gases.
High pressure loads from the compressed airflow.

variant.question: In a gas turbine engine, the propelling jet is generated by:

options.text: expansion of hot gases resulting in a conversion of potential energy (pressure) into kinetic energy (velocity).
expansion of hot gases resulting in a conversion of potential energy (pressure) into (mechanical) work.
compression of hot gases resulting in a conversion of potential energy (pressure) into kinetic energy (velocity).
compression of hot gases resulting in a conversion of kinetic energy (velocity) into (mechanical) work.

variant.question: Specific fuel consumption for a turbojet engine is the mass of fuel burned per (1) _____ divided by the (2) _____ produced.

options.text: (1) hour; (2) thrust
(1) mile; (2) thrust
(1) hour; (2) speed
(1) mile; (2) speed
